title: Updated Spellblade VFX on PBE
body:
Hi everybody! We’re here with a visual update to some of our older item effects in League.

There are new VFX for the Spellblade passive on Sheen, Iceborn Gauntlet, Trinity Force, and Lich Bane on PBE. We want to maintain the current readability, but get these effects to better match League’s current art style.

You can check them out in some images below! (Old on left and new on right)

**Sheen / Trinity Force**

https://i.imgur.com/zRNJPJY.png

**Lich Bane**

https://i.imgur.com/kZbf5Su.png

**Iceborn Gauntlet**

https://i.imgur.com/5vM72nf.png

Do these still read as the same buffs to you? Are the new buffs as noticeable as the ones on Live? Do they feel cleaner and clearer than the Live versions? We'd love to hear your thoughts!

replies.body: I also think the white starburst should stay (or something different but with similar effect) especially since the new approach seems a bit blurry. Other than that it's great to see new stuff!

What this guy said, the starburst is what makes them more unique than the various other VFX in game. The new colors though would definitely help. Also an addition like what NegaBlitz said would be great, to turn triforce's VFX Golden, to further differentiate it from sheen
no need stars...

Looks like you just made them not shiny which imo will make them blend with other visual effects even more. For instance, look at sheen/trinity force. The red over the hand above her body blends in pretty significantly. The old version is much easier to make out due to the shine it provides.

Same, I think putting more shiny beam things with high contrast centers around the hands ups the clarity.
Glad to see I'm not the only one.

**Iceborn Gauntlet** looks great. The others are definitely not as noticeable due to the softer colors and greater diffusion at the edges, although they are cleaner. **Lichbane** would also probably be *entirely* invisible in Singed's poison, which worries me.

From a VFX perspective, they look nice; there's definitely a concern of readability though.

Checking just in gray-scale, Sheen/Trinity Force doesn't stand out much and Lich Bane is basically invisible.

Putting them through some Color Blind filters, Iceborn looks great, Lich Bane is difficult to see with tritanopia, and Sheen/Trinity Force is questionable with protanopia and deutanopia.

The takeaways here are that the bright white aspects of the current ones help them stand out, especially for Sheen/Trinity Force. For Lich Bane, the visibility is primarily in the harsh edge distinction of the starburst effect between its brighter interior and darker exterior colors. If you wanted to achieve a similar effect for that, the lighter parts could possibly be swapped out to something like a darker black, maybe making it look a bit void-y?
They look great, but the one for Sheen/Trinity is a little dull. I'd be interested to see an animated comparison.

Some of them might be hard to identify under the effects of:

{{item:3504}} {{item:2139}} {{item:2140}} 

Granted that might already be the case but its something worth mentioning.

Trying to think of more..

I would've made tri-force more yellow, lich bane more red, and ice born more blue, not only fitting to their item colors, but also you're less likely to see those kind of buffs interfer visually this way.

- Yellow for triforce would work because there is a lack of yellow particles so its more unique and most champs will be fine with it. Orange if worried about color blindness.

- Red for lich works out because there are no AP items that also give red effects, AP typically doesn't get ardent censor focused on them, so it stands out better rather then purple meshing with dark blue sorcery (and purple just seems strange, why purple?)

- Blue for ice born works out for most tanks since visually tanks don't get a lot of particles or sorcery elixirs. Only case I can think of is ice born skarner with W but its such a niche scenario. 

And friendly reminder to address colorblindness if you haven't already. Usually this kind of stuff ships and it gets assessed later.
The red and purple are purposefully made that way to show what damage type they are. Physical or Magic.

What worries me is that Sheen/Triforce is still impossible to see in combination with Nunu's blood boil. It uses very similar particles of the same colour that completely masks it, and this doesn't seem to change that.
Can't imagine that'll be much of a problem that they'll consider, seeing as he's getting reworked.
True and that part of nunus kit will be a gonner

for the most part yes, although when it comes to lich bane the spikiness of the effect is the 1st thing that gets noticed in teamfights rather than a purple hue. Nothing against it but maybe some spiky white on the new one would fix that.
Too soft imo. Iceborn is the best.

I like most of them, though they seem a bit blurry. It's like a combination of the old effect and the newer one we've had for a while.

Also as a related question: Why not give Triforce its own effects? It could have like a golden aura instead of a red one to differentiate between it and Sheen.

That's pretty neat!
My only complaint though is how Iceborn's new VFX kinda looks more galactic-themed with its new colors rather than icy-themed.
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Definitely a 11/10
Clarity nice!

looks fine but this change is really out of the blue.
any reason behind suddenly wanting to change the particles?
From what I can see the lich bane looks better.
Sparkles!

As long as the softer tone doesn't reduce clarity on overlapping effects like {{item:2015}}, {{item:3042}} this is a good direction if a bit too opaque.

Also I was wondering what your thoughts would be on adding a similar charged effect to {{item:3285}}, {{item:1414}}. Unlike other items with singular on-[action] effects these I don't think they have any indicator other than the buff bar.

I guess the new effects actually remind me of the old engines effects.. similar to the mawofmalmortius effect current red hands particles for the sheen.  I would still prefer to see the old yellow Lich Bane effect from vanilla league
Old is 10x better and I have no clue why you're changing this.

The ones on the left (old) are definitely clearer and less muted. I don't know if pushing them back (new) is what you really want to do if your goal is to improve clarity as the more muted affects could be even harder to notice. The new version on Irelia almost looks like it's part of her actual skin design. I also don't know if people had a problem with this in the first place, I never did, must be busy work for the graphics team.

Lich and ice look great. Sheen/trin I  feel doesn’t have a unique enough look to it. 

Maybe explore with the shape?
Maybe a yellow aura for trinity rather that the same as the sheen

I think the old one is better. Lich bane for instance it just makes your character purple rather than having an effect

Old effect -- have color and texture
New effect -- have color but no texture

Sheen does look kinda flat and dull by comparison, but the Lich and Iceborn ones look awesome! Definitely more distinguishable and instantly recognizable 
{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Looks pretty nice tho i didnt think Sheen needed an update to its VFX since it isn't super dated
